title: Infinitives of Purpose Exercise 1
description: Change these sentences so that they have an infinitive of purpose (to + infinitive)

parts.value: I went to Japan because I wanted to learn Japanese.

parts.answer: I went to Japan to learn Japanese.
answerList: I went to Japan to learn Japanese.

parts.value: She made a cake because she wanted to please her friend.

parts.answer: She made a cake to please her friend.
answerList: She made a cake to please her friend.

parts.value: They study a lot because they want to get good marks.

parts.answer: They study a lot to get good marks.
answerList: They study a lot to get good marks.

parts.value: Amanda is going to the party because she wants to meet new people.

parts.answer: Amanda is going to the party to meet new people.
answerList: Amanda is going to the party to meet new people.

parts.value: The children went to the park because they wanted to play football.

parts.answer: The children went to the park to play football.
answerList: The children went to the park to play football.

parts.value: Jorge studied German because he wanted to get a new job.

parts.answer: Jorge studied German to get a new job.
answerList: Jorge studied German to get a new job.

parts.value: We went to France because we wanted to eat lots of nice food.

parts.answer: We went to France to eat lots of nice food.
answerList: We went to France to eat lots of nice food.

parts.value: She got a new computer because she wanted to write a book.

parts.answer: She got a new computer to write a book.
answerList: She got a new computer to write a book.

parts.value: He has been running because he wants to lose weight.

parts.answer: He has been running to lose weight.
answerList: He has been running to lose weight.

parts.value: We must study every day because we want to improve our English.

parts.answer: We must study every day to improve our English.
answerList: We must study every day to improve our English.
